item.title: Judges 1
item.description: v1 After the death of Joshua, the children of Israel asked of Yahweh, saying, “Who should go up for us first against the Canaanites, to fight against them?

item.title: Judges 2
item.description: v1 Yahweh’s angel came up from Gilgal to Bochim. He said, “I brought you out of Egypt, and have brought you to the land which I swore to give your fathers.

item.title: Judges 3
item.description: v1 Now these are the nations which Yahweh left, to test Israel by them, even as many as had not known all the wars of Canaan;

item.title: Judges 4
item.description: v1 The children of Israel again did that which was evil in Yahweh’s sight, when Ehud was dead.

item.title: Judges 5
item.description: v1 Then Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam sang on that day, saying,

item.title: Judges 6
item.description: v1 The children of Israel did that which was evil in Yahweh’s sight, so Yahweh delivered them into the hand of Midian seven years.

item.title: Judges 7
item.description: v1 Then Jerubbaal, who is Gideon, and all the people who were with him, rose up early and encamped beside the spring of Harod.

item.title: Judges 8
item.description: v1 The men of Ephraim said to him, “Why have you treated us this way, that you didn’t call us when you went to fight with Midian?

item.title: Judges 9
item.description: v1 Abimelech the son of Jerubbaal went to Shechem to his mother’s brothers, and spoke with them and with all the family of the house of his mother’s father, saying,

item.title: Judges 10
item.description: v1 After Abimelech, Tola the son of Puah, the son of Dodo, a man of Issachar, arose to save Israel.

item.title: Judges 11
item.description: v1 Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty man of valor.

item.title: Judges 12
item.description: v1 The men of Ephraim were gathered together, and passed northward; and they said to Jephthah, “Why did you pass over to fight against the children of Ammon, and didn’t call us to go with you?

item.title: Judges 13
item.description: v1 The children of Israel again did that which was evil in Yahweh’s sight; and Yahweh delivered them into the hand of the Philistines forty years.

item.title: Judges 14
item.description: v1 Samson went down to Timnah, and saw a woman in Timnah of the daughters of the Philistines.

item.title: Judges 15
item.description: v1 But after a while, in the time of wheat harvest, Samson visited his wife with a young goat.

item.title: Judges 16
item.description: v1 Samson went to Gaza, and saw there a prostitute, and went in to her.

item.title: Judges 17
item.description: v1 There was a man of the hill country of Ephraim, whose name was Micah.

item.title: Judges 18
item.description: v1 In those days there was no king in Israel. In those days the tribe of the Danites sought an inheritance to dwell in; for to that day, their inheritance had not fallen to them among the tribes of Israel.

item.title: Judges 19
item.description: v1 In those days, when there was no king in Israel, there was a certain Levite living on the farther side of the hill country of Ephraim, who took for himself a concubine out of Bethlehem Judah.

item.title: Judges 20
item.description: v1 Then all the children of Israel went out, and the congregation was assembled as one man, from Dan even to Beersheba, with the land of Gilead, to Yahweh at Mizpah.

item.title: Judges 21
item.description: v1 Now the men of Israel had sworn in Mizpah, saying, “None of us will give his daughter to Benjamin as a wife.
